p: The AgNPs synthesis and stability are usually monitored by recording the UV-Vis spectrum during the reaction, detecting the characteristic SPR peak in the 400â€“450 nm range: 410 nm [ 199], 420 nm [ 189, 194], 430 nm [ 185, 203], or 450 nm [ 186]. For other types of MeNPs, the appearance of the SPR band at more than 500 nm demonstrates the synthesis of AuNPs [ 191, 206] with an increase of the absorbance intensity in time [ 191]. In other cases, the broad absorption peak at 330 nm demonstrates the monodisperse nature of the formed ZnONPs [ 187], and the broad peak found between 200 and 300 nm in the case of CuNPs reflects a wide size distribution, while the intrinsic band gap absorption at a wavelength smaller than 400 nm is attributed to TiO 2NPs formation [ 202].
